Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mlfunnell
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Seattle. We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Seattle City Center with a family of 6. The 2 room suite accommodated us perfectly. The breakfast was a wonderful start to the day. There were plenty of options that were able to satisfy even my hungry teenage boys. There were 3-4 staff members tending the breakfast area and kept it well stocked and cleaned. We had a great view of the Space Needle right from our room! The staff was very friendly and informative about the area. We were only there for 2 days and did not rent a car. We were able to walk to City Center where there are many options for lunch and dinner. We did take the sight seeing tour bus and were able to see all that Seattle has to offer as we were able to hop on and off at our leisure. The hotel is located on a busy highway, but the noise did not bother us at night. We would definitely stay here the next time we come to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Low Prices”
Reviews.Author: gineva_14
Reviews.Content: I took my friends to Seattle for their first time, the hotel was in a great area. We were able to quickly walk to the space needle or catch a $5 cab ride to downtown. And the front desk supervior, Jeff, was so helpful. He gave us some quick tips of restaurants. We'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Steattle base for the a great price”
Reviews.Author: gellunia7
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was very pleasant and enjoyable. The staff were extremely nice and helpful, always smiling and with good suggestions. Room service was prompt and we never run out of anything. The room was well equipped and very comfortable, although we did really just sleep in it. We did ask for a view of the Space Needle and it was great. It was on the 6th floor and had slanted ceiling, which made it very spacious. However, it did overlook a busy Aurora street, which was quite noisy when we had our windows open. But once you shut the window, it was quiet. We were too tired to hear it anyways after a whole day of exploring. The hotel has high speed internet and Wi-Fi in the lobby with couple of computers for guests to use. However, there is no Wi-Fi in the rooms. The staff will provide a cable to hook up your laptop, if you don't have yours. The breakfast buffet was served from 6am to 10am and offered a great array of choices, from heavy and hearty to healthy and light. We stayed there for 6 days and I had a different breakfast everyday. As we were out exploring all day, we never used any facilities like pool or fitness room. However, the pool was small and the fitness room had just couple of treadmills and elliptical machines. The location of the hotel is great! It's just a 5 min. walk to Space Needle and all the attractions of City Center like Sci-Fi Museum and Pacific Science Center with IMAX theaters. There is a Monorail by the Space Needle that for $4 takes you Downtown in about 3 minutes. That is a fun experience, but not worth taking everyday, as it takes about 10 minutes to walk Downtown. If you want to get to Pike Place Market and other Downtown attractions, you'll walk about 20 minutes from the hotel. If you don't like or can't walk too much, buses will take you everywhere and once you stay within Downtown district, they are free. There is a bus stop right across the street from the hotel. We came to the hotel from the airport on two buses, which was easy enough, as we were instructed over the phone by the hotel staff how to do it exactly. And it only cost us about $8 for two people. However, going away we had way too much stuff with us. Conveniently, the hotel has a Town Car service that charges around $30 flat rate to the airport and you can schedule for specific time, which you cannot do with taxis. Overall, it was a great stay and I definitely recommend this hotel. It's a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Little piece of heaven after a long bus ride!”
Reviews.Author: Princessfromoz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night after a long and delayed bus ride from Vancouver and it was just what I was hoping for. Warm and inviting room, nice decor, very clean bathroom and bed was luscious with choice of pillows. The room was a good size and had everything you could need. TV with cable, wifi, coffee/tea etc. Toiletries were quite good too. There was a little room with computers and printers downstairs which came in handy with bookings etc although, there were only 2 computers and 1 working printer so at times there was a bit of a wait. Complimentary breakfast was great!! Everything that you could expect and more, bacon, eggs, pastries, bagel, toast, fruit, muffins, cereal, coffee/tea, juice, yoghurt! Breakfast room was nice and spacious too, didn't have to wait for a table at all. Location was good for us as it was only a couple of blocks to the Greyhound station and a few blocks in the opposite direction to the space needle and seattle center. There was a good pizza place about 5 min walk away, however, other than that not a lot happening in the area. Streets were very quiet. Staff were fine but not necessarily friendly, seemed to rush you through as quickly as possible and didn't really want to help out with transport to the airport other than booking a town car. We ended up getting the greylines airport shuttle from Warwick Hotel down the road and saved about $14 doing it. Overall, a great place for 1-2 night stay but if you want to see all that seattle has to offer, not just the space needle - consider staying a little further downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a great price”
Reviews.Author: snownana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends for a week and we enjoyed our stay. Both rooms were spacious & clean with views of the Space Needle. The hotel was within walking distance of several attractions & a short drive to several others. There wer several small neighborhood restaurants that offered a variety of food choices. The staff was friendly & extremely helpful. They greeted us every time we returned to the hotel & checked to see if we were enjoing our stay. The breakfast was typical of what Holiday in Express offers. The area was clean & well stocked. The traffic noise was never a problem as we kept our windows closed. The parking spaces are small but should not be a factor in the selection of the hotel. All in all a good value!

Reviews.Title: “A Convenient Home Base in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: ashley627
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights in April 2009 while exploring Seattle. It's conveniently located within walking distance of the Space Needle and other City Center attractions (including a monorail that will take you to other parts of the city). This hotel has all of my favorite things about Holiday Inn Express -- clean, fresh linens; a great breakfast; and free wireless Internet access. The room was clean, comfortable and reasonably priced, and the staff were friendly and helpful. My only hesitation is the location; there weren't very many restaurants within walking distance. It might be better to stay near Pike Place or Pioneer Square instead.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to shop in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Malagababy
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at this hotel (first time was 2004). As Holiday Inn Expresses go, it's fine. The neighbourhood isn't great (not a lot of amenities) but it's far cheaper than staying downtown in Seattle. You can walk easily to the Space Needle and the Music Experience and hop onto the Monorail to downtown. My only gripe is the parking lot is really small. I drive a small car, and I found getting in and out of the parking spots difficult. The hotel is very clean and comfortable, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jajabink
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever been. The room is big, clean, everything is in good condition. The mattress is super comfortable, the best compared with all previous hotels I stayed in! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The price is unbelievably cheap with no extra charge for more than 2 people. And finally the complimentary breakfast is unbeatable with so many selections. This hotel is amazing. We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: Blaize76
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. My room was spacious and clean. The hotel was within walking distance to several big attractions and some really great neighborhood restaurants. The only downfall was I heard the hum of traffic at night. However, for the price I got on the hotel, I would gladly bring along earplugs to drown out the noise. Also they don't have wireless internet so if you are planning on using the internet you should bring your own cable or you can lease one from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: hanlgt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly next to the Holiday Inn, but it overlooks Aurora Highway and it is not that easy to walk to places, but I enjoyed my stay. I got upgraded to a King "suite" which, although overlooking the highway, had a great view of the Space Needle, and Seattle City Center, which was 6 blocks away. I walked over there to the Music Experience, which was an enjoyable wander, and an interesting Frank Gehry building, but it is not a straight walk, due to the fact that you can't cross the highway right there near the hotel. There was a huge Jacuzzi tub in my room, and also a little kitchette area with a fridge and microwave and little sink. The bed was comfortable and the internet was free and the breakfast was crowded, but I just grabbed a couple of things and went back to my room to eat it. The staff was polite and very helpful and if you don't have to be near the downtown area of Seattle, it is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but stay in the Business district”
Reviews.Author: dahacker
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly because we have a 3 year old and finding hotels with two room suites is difficult. We stayed in their two room kids suite and this was excellent for us. The second room has bunk beds for the kids and can be closed off so that they can go to bed early and the adults can stay up for a while longer. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Very little noise. Parking underneath the hotel is fine. The breakfast is not included in the price, but there is a restaurant on premises that serves a great breakfast. Location. It was not a prime location. It was about a 5 block walk to the space needle, which is good, but that is pretty much all there is to do there. You can take the monorail into the true center of town though. If I stayed in Seattle again, I would recommend staying more downtown in the business district or even south of that. Then just use the monorail to go from downtown to the space needle. Again, I wasn't disapointed with the hotel, just recommending a better location, so you can walk to restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Patsina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise. Large clean room, adequate bathroom, helpful desk staff who booked a tour and called a taxi for us, excellent breakfast selection. A group of students was there that night but we never heard a sound from the hallway. The only possible drawback was that there's not much to do in the area right around the hotel, but we were able to take a taxi to Pike St. Market, and the tour bus picked us up right at the hotel the following morning and brought us to our cruise ship's terminal afterwards. This was our second stay at a Holiday Inn Express and both times they exceeded our expectations. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What are you expecting?”
Reviews.Author: Groupeventplanner
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Seattle. This is the typical hotel chain my husband and I stay at, to save a little money for everything else that goes into a vacation. This hotel is just fine for a Holiday Inn. I really think some people have some high expectations, and you can't do that here! We had a great room with a view of the Space Needle. Yes, there is traffic below, but I never noticed it. It's about 15-20 minute walk down to Pike Place Market, the real highlight of this city. Your best bet is to go down Battery to 1st Avenue. You will avoid most of the numerous homeless people that plague downtown Seattle. The room was very clean, breakfast was great, though very crowded. We only parked a car for 1 night, and after getting stuck at the end of the parking lot, we got a spot that fit our sedan rental. Parking is tight, but the price is not bad. I did a lot of research before going on this trip - months of research. I encourage anyone who enjoys walking to stay at this hotel and save some cash. I didn't find the monorail to be helpful in getting down to Pikes Place Market, it is better for the shopping district only. SafeCo Field was about 2 miles from the hotel and we walked to two games while we were there, not bad at all, as long as you take the right route. Through all of my research, I never saw information on the big homeless problem here, and most appear to be on drugs, so be cautious what you carry and the streets you take. We were never bothered, but I would have been uncomfortable if I were by myself.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay on vacation”
Reviews.Author: TimmyB1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on our way to Hawai'i. It is a great place to stay, clean, comfortable, great free breakfast, etc. Make sure that you get a view of the Space Needle because, if you don't, you probably have a view of the hotel 5 feet behind this one!!! We are both runners and we also love to walk to places, so this hotel is right for people like us. If you don't like to walk more than a few blocks, you need to spend the big $$$ and stay closer to your places you want to visit. We easily walked to the Space Needle in about 10 minutes, downtown to the Pike Place area in about 30. One thing that is nice is if you walk to either area, the monorail that was built for the World's Fair in 1960 (?) still shuttles back and forth between the two areas for two bucks. It drops you off right at the very nice, downtown shopping district, only a few blocks from the Pike Place Market. Also, there are tours that will pick you up right here and take you to places like Boeing, etc. We paid about $160 per night, which includes all taxes, etc. For the money, a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The real scoop .....”
Reviews.Author: stacyfortin
Reviews.Content: The location was very convenient, right downtown. Staff was very accommodating and helpful. Parking was a bit of a problem if you were arriving late - past 10:00 pm. In the hotel's defense I have yet to stay at a hotel in a large city with an abundance of parking. The elevator was painfully slow, allow extra time or get some exercise on the stairs. Continental breakfast was very good and the room was clean. Noise was fairly minimal, again when you stay in a large city you have to expect some noise from the high activity. If you are wanting a quiet retreat, consider a different destination all together. Five blocks from the Space Needle and about a twenty minute drive in high traffic to Safeco Field. Overall a positive experience and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: KLW610
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Seattle and chose a Holiday Inn as we had always had a good experience there. We always have had good quality and a clean room. When we first got there we could not find a place to park. Not only that when we pulled up near the doors it was such a small area for people who were coming and going that I had to be sure to get in the drivers seat in case I needed to move the car. My husband got out only to find out that we were at the wrong Holiday Inn. There was another one on the backside in the same parking lot. So once we circled so we could pull up to the right hotel come to find out that the parking garage for "our" hotel was full and we were told we would have to park in the garage of the other Holiday Inn. So everytime we went to the car we would have to go downstairs out the building and down the way to the other hotel lobby downstairs to the underground garage. Not to mention the fact that this was a busy area and not sure of how great it was. So I was not too happy to walk around there with my 5 year old daughter. We got to our "non-smoking" room and smelled smoke the entire night we stayed there! Plus the fact that the building was old and the curtains didn't close! We had to use the blanket off the bed to cover the window. We paid $189 which was way too much for the worst hotel not to mention our first stay in Seattle. I was so glad we were only staying one night. Holiday Inn Express really let themselves go there.

Reviews.Title: “unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Rose49
Reviews.Content: If you encounter a problem, like we did, this would not be the hotel that you would want to stay at. The front desk was unhelpful, rude, smug and basically refused to do anything to help. When I spoke with the manger, she was equally unhelpful. She offered "deep regrets" and this was follwed by, but there was nothing we could do about it. We had booked this hotel because it was the only one left in the downtown area (now I know why it was the hotel of last resort). I would stay outside of town rather than deal with these folks.

Reviews.Title: “Dont forget anything..it will take them 2-3 weeks to get it back to you!!”
Reviews.Author: mbruggeman9
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, the elevators were mega slow. My overall stay was pretty good...until I forgot my WORK computer power cord in the room. I didn't realize till I got to the airport, and called immediately later that morning. Since its my work computer there is definitely a sense of urgency, and I tried to relay that. Well...here it is 12 DAYS later...and its still not here (in Chicago). I think they had it delivered via covered wagon. THANKS Holiday Inn Express Seattle City Center!!!

Reviews.Title: “For families”
Reviews.Author: ac1510
Reviews.Content: First of all, do not get a suite room unless you want to face a freeway and the noise. Yes you can see the space needle but it's not worth the aggravation of a noisy night. Ask for a standard room that does not have a view of the space needle if you want quiet! This hotel is full of families and therefore lot's of kids. I had no problem with noise in my room though but the breakfast can be a little unnerving if you aren't used to a circus first thing in the morning. It's not very central for downtown. I would stay closer next time- similar prices at the Sheraton which was much better for location. The service though was very good and I found management went out of there way to accommodate people. I just feel the location isn't the greatest and it's really geared to families who will benefit from the cheap parking and free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough!”
Reviews.Author: gregdane
Reviews.Content: I met my parents here for quick 3-day vacation after their 60th anniversary cruise to Alaska. They had also stayed here before their cruise. No major complaints- rooms were clean and large enough but no K in suites, Q-size only- :( Complimentary (ha!) breakfast very good for what it was but often resembles a cattle call during peak hours (7:30 to 8:30?). For some reason my room booked under my mother's name, hers booked under my name- ? Still trying to get that resolved and points credited to correct accounts. All in all, a nice stay and would recommend it if you're satisfied with an average national chain that still gets most things right.

Reviews.Title: “Slow Internet Connection - nice view”
Reviews.Author: runningman_22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for three nights on business for a conference. I am used to staying in Holiday Inn Express hotels and they are usually hit or miss. This one is OK. It is within walking distance (10 mins) of the Seattle Center and restaurants, although a bit of a convoluted path since you have to cross over HWY 99 and you can only do that at one spot. It is not in the best of locations but good enough for the price. My biggest gripe is the internet connection!! Since I was there on business this was important to me and it as at dial-up speed. However, I did have a top floor room with a great view of the space needle. I probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gerturd
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. It is in a great location. Very near the space needle and many restaurants. The staff was very nice and knowledgeable about the area. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Think I would pass”
Reviews.Author: ljc1347
Reviews.Content: Although the price was good (for Seattle), the room needed a good cleaning and updating. We have stayed at Holiday Inn Express that have the comfortable beds with new bedding, this one was disappointing. The toilet was plugged when we got into the room, there was a bag of food left in the microwave, the carpet was dirty, the curtains had a big stain on them and the blankets also had stains. The room had a busy freeway right out front, so I would suggest earplugs. We typically stay at holiday inn express because you know what you can expect but think I would pass on staying at this one again. On the upside, the staff was very friendly and we did have a good view of the space needle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a view of the Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: frecl
Reviews.Content: I stayed for at this hotel during two nights (but not consequtive). As a Priority Club Platinum I was give a room with the view fo the Space Needle the first night. The second night I was given suite with separate bedromm and large hot tub. As the view of the Space Needle was great I recommend asking for this at checkin. Also note that even though the Space Needle is close you can not walk the closest way as there is a freeway right i front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great in almost every way”
Reviews.Author: rubytue
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay near the airport, we quickly changed our second night to this hotel. We couldn't have been more happy! This hotel was clean and well kept. The location was a quick walk to the monorail and Space Needle. Since it was just before Christmas (12/23), we were able to walk to the City Center at night for ice skating, carousel riding, and just enjoying the lights of the city. The room itself was clean, and the little bottles of stuff were excellent. Also, it had the great Holiday Inn pillows! The bathroom, on the other hand, was clean but TINY! My only complaint about the hotel is that there are not many restaurants within walking distance (something I like in a downtown hotel). Also, on our second stay (2 days after Christmas), the hotel had many more people and parking was a bit tight.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: SONNYSMOM
Reviews.Content: I showed up expecting to be disappointed but I was pleasantly surpised. The hotel is somewhat out of the way, but is a short taxi ride from the Paramount if you are seeing a show there. Rooms were nice, and clean, Beds were comfortable and the sheets were clean and nice smelling. (trust me I look) I had forgotten my shampoo and conditoner and actually put the stuff they sampled in my hair! That was a big plus. If it is nice and warm out it is a nice walk to the Pacific Science Center, but that wasnt the case for us so we stayed in the room. We stayed the night before a Seahawks game so expect some partiers.. but hey who doesnt love football! The gentleman on the nightstaff were friendly and courteous and even called to see if I needed anything. The breakfast was great, and the breakfast room was VERY busy but the staff kept up and they were big hearty men eating before their day at the game. The only drawback, was housekeeping knocked on my door at 8am, and barged in scaring the crap out of my kid, so if you have one I recommend putting up a Do not disturb sign.

Reviews.Title: “great view, not so great location...”
Reviews.Author: MaineGirlAtHeart
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here at the Holiday Inn Express in Downtown Seattle mainly for the view. My room had a straight on view of the space needle, which was very cool. Not only that, the staff went out of their way to help me score the room. Unfortunately, it is on a major road making it quite loud. When I arrived, my telvevision and remote didn't work and it took some tries to get someone up to my room who could fix it. They staff were incredibly nice about it, though. And it did eventually get fixed by a maintence worker. The locations is.... walkable to downtown, but not in the nicest area. I didn't feel comfortable walking home alone at night, but the cab was cheap enough! My room is wonderful, clean, and as always-- free breakfast. I am not sure if I would stay here again, but it was nice to see the Space Needle up close and personal.

Reviews.Title: “clean comfy bed and pillows”
Reviews.Author: hootydog
Reviews.Content: traveled from TX having one day to see Seattle before moving on to Whidbey Island..Got a bus shuttle to hotel from SeaTac for $12.50 which was a good a tour of downtown, stopping at other hotels. The room was clean the beds extra comfy which was a relief after a long plane ride. Staff was smiling and friendly. Parking was $8 nightly so less than other hotels. Breakfast room was well stocked and nice but we only grabbed juice and coffee before opting to go to Pike Market for breakfast. Interesting that the breakfast room required a room key to enter, extra security is OK with me. Hotel is close to Pike Market. Friendly staff called a yellow cab for us, $5.50 to Pike Market and no traffic hassles or parking worries. We used those yellow cabs several times and always friendly and proffesional. Once we used an orange cab and were charged 3 bucks more and got a rude driver, he lost his tip, Oh well. I would stay at this location again when visiting. The 2 queen room was pricey in my book but compared to the local hotels was within normal range.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: OllieMonster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a typical Holiday Inn Express - clean, comfortable rooms - but a little on the small side. The bathroom in our room was tiny and the shower was fitted too low. Our first room was incredibly noisy because it was by the elevator and the vending machines - the elevator was quiet, but they have the loudest ice machine that filled every 12 minutes. We asked to move room and our next room was fine and quiet. Location suited us because it was near to the space needle and we could use the monorail to go to the shopping district, pike place market etc. Not sure how late the monorail runs though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Trvltwo
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at the Holiday Inn Express City Center, prior to our Alaska cruise. I used my Holiday Inn points for a King Suite with Jacuzzi, and a Space Needle view. Although our room did not have a jacuzzi, which I wouldn't have used anyway, it was a very nice suite. It had a sitting area with sofa, a microwave, refrig, sink, and cupboards in the kitchen area, and a very small bathroom. The smallest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel. The sink and counter area were located outside the bathroom, which seemed strange, but was actually nice to be able to use it, while my husband took a shower. The bed was very comfortable, the shower was awesome, and the suite was very clean. The suite had 2 windows, one of which was directly in line with the Space Needle...great view!! We walked all over the downtown area, as the hotel is within walking distance of everything. Downtown areas are not always the greatest, but we never felt unsafe. The Space Needle is only 4-5 blocks, and the Fish Market is around a mile, and the same to Pier 66. We ate at 13 Coins downtown, the food was very good, but very expensive!! The staff was very friendly, and very helpful with directions, and such. They do not have an airport shuttle, we took a cab, and I believe it was around $34.00. They do have a shuttle to Pier 66 though, that the front desk will arrange for you, it is $5.00 per person oneway. We enjoyed our short stay, and loved Seattle. We will be returning, and will definitely stay again at the Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Robwca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on Aug 24th. on my up to Mt. Shuksan for a weekend climb, and back on Aug. 26th. from the mountains. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The rooms was very clean., and the breakfast was good. You're virtually right next door to the Space Needle. I could see it from my hotel room. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rooms, good price...”
Reviews.Author: tlrtravel
Reviews.Content: We went to Seattle on a last minute trip, and booked this hotel day of for $188 w/BCAA discount....not a bad price. We thought the hotel was pretty good: -nice (if not a bit small) heated indoor pool -free continental breakfast (go early or it's a zoo in there!) -underground parking (a bit tight for SUV's but 'do-able') -short walk to liquor 'store' aka a gas station -a few quick blocks to the 'seattle centre' (space needle, carnival, etc) -a very short drive to Pike Place Market We had a 'mini suite', I think they called it. There was a king bed, a pull-out sofa, small kitchenette (fridge, microwave, sink), desk, tv, armchair, open vanity sink area (granite), and a closed room with toilet and large tub. Everything was very new from the carpeting to the bedding & towels.....very nice for a holiday inn! We had a great time here, and it was a very easy location to find. No complaints really, we even ate dinner at their restaurant and that was surprisingly good! We also had a view of the Space Needle from both of our room windows! Overall good value here, and a comfortable place to sleep :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lhs1
Reviews.Content: Had a king suite w/ jacuzzi. Came with Fridge, microwave, small kitchen area. Room was clean and large but only had basic amenities (soap/shampoo/conditioner). 3 blocks to the bus which can take you to the water for $1.25. Not quite in the center of town but for the price the location was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I did stay at Holiday Inn Express Last Night!”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at this hotel in late June with wife and two boys (7 and 4) while in town for a conference. The front desk staff (Jena and Jeff) were great from the moment we checked in. I had several questions about stores, buses, attractions, etc. and they eagerly answered them all. Being a Priority Club member, I was even greeted with cookies! I splurged for a King suite with jacuzzi tub - it was great to have the extra space - basically a standard bedroom that had a sofabed, with a smaller bedroom connected with a door. We did look out the back at the adjacent Holiday Inn, but the extra space made up for the lack of a view. The oversized jacuzzi tub was great - like having our own hot tub! Internet worked well, but does require an ethernet cable. I have just started carrying one with me all the time. There is also a small business center in the lobby with two computers and printers - great for printing boarding passes. The kids (and I) enjoyed the indoor pool that was actually heated. True, it's not huge, but it is ample. Hey, it's the only decent hotel in the downtown area that has a pool. You can walk to the Space Needle and adjacent museums and amusement park in 5 minutes. It's an easy walk with signals to cross streets. You can also walk to a bus stop in the downtown free bus ride zone in about 5-10 minutes. The free ride zone covers a large area. You really don't need a car here. We worked our way down to the waterfront one evening and had a great meal at Fishermans. We took a cab back and it was only $10, including a $2 tip. I parked a rental car here the first night - yes, its tight parking, but not nearly as bad as I expected from the previous reviews. I returned the car on the first Monday (original plan - we had it for a week touring around the state - see other reviews for Sheraton Airport Portland, OR; Quality Inn Ocean Shores, WA; Quality Inn Port Angeles, WA; Qualtiy Inn Downtown Victoria, BC) so didn't have to park the remaining nights. We ate a dinner at the adjacent Holiday Inn - fairly plain food, but kids eat free - nice budget break during a two-week trip! I used the washer/dryer facilities one night - the detergent machine took my money - the front desk staff gladly gave me a box without question. Hint - if you have to have a rental car while in Seattle, reserve it from the downtown location - you can save ~$90 in taxes on a week's rental. It pays for the cab ride to the rental location and the town car ride from the HIExpress back to the airport and more. The hotel will arrange a town car to take you to the airport for a $30 flat rate - less than a metered cab fare. I would stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it for the staff service, pool, location near the Seattle Center complex (space needle, museums, etc) and proximity to the real downtown, considering the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Potential Peepers-with little hotel concern”
Reviews.Author: biznestravler
Reviews.Content: This was a mixed bag, but included one of the more disturbing moments in all of my stays at a hotel. I was in a room facing another hotel (Quality Inn I believe) and the Space Needle behind it. One night while in my room I was gazing out of my window at the space needle when I noticed a dark silhouette of a person pacing back and forth on the opposing hotel roof. As I looked closer I noticed the person had a camera and could see the red light blinking occationaly indicating he was in fact taking pictures, I can only assume at the windows in the Holiday Inn Express. Concerned I called the front desk immediately and informed the front desk clerk. To my astonishment, my concerns were all but disregarded as he informed me they were quite busy and he would call the other hotel when he had a moment. Appalled I asked for the number to call myself and did just that to inform the Quality Inn someone was on their roof, apparently taking pictures of the guests at the HIE. When I checked out, I once again explained the situation and my disbelief in the quality of response. This person was much more appologetic and responsive and did give me a follow-up call after I checked out saying they were checking into it with the other hotel. I understand things happen, and the person taking pictures was not on the roof of the Holiday Inn Express. What I can NOT understand is how low a priority catching a person peeping on your guests is given. I am a business traveler and was traveling alone. I don't imagine the guy was taking pictures of someone like myself...but to imagine someone taking pictures of my wife, daughter or mother is very upsetting. To not do anything about it-is infuriating! Needless to say I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Icebear
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in the Holiday Inn Express in Seattle in May 2007 and we really enjoyed it. The rooms are very spacious and if you´re lucky you get a view on the Space Needle (in walking distance!) for free... :-) The continental breakfast which was included for us was excellent. There were donuts, bagels, fresh fruit, cereals, several juices, cinnamon rolls, coffee, tea, ... The hotel has a office room with free internet access, a (small) fitness room and an indoor pool. Unfortunately the office room was closed for several days during our stay. The staff was very friendly. There are some bus stops in walking distance to catch a bus to downtown (appr. 10 min. ride), one of these is already in the Seattle free ride zone. The only thing we can complain about is the fact that the surrounding area is something strange. At night you may feel a little uncomfortable when walking on your own. Nevertheless we would return at any time to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, not great!”
Reviews.Author: ficas
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express in Seattle is pretty much what you'd expect for the money, but there are a few things I would have liked to have known before booking it. The wash basin is in the bedroom - not a major issue, but because of this the bathroom is really small, and there isn't anywhere to put your belongings, no basin means no handy shelf, and as the bath is moulded up the wall there's very little space here either. There are no proper curtains! The windows are dressed with a sheer curtain and curtain panels on either side, the panels don't move, so if you'd like an afternoon nap, or a long lie-in it's going to be difficult as you can't block out the light. Aurora Avenue N has a barrier all along the centre of it so you have to cross the street at the junction south of the hotel (Denny Way), no big deal, unless you're really tired from lots of walking and you can see your hotel but just have to walk that little bit further to get to it. As I said it's nothing major, but just a couple of things I'd like to have known.

Reviews.Title: “very happy during our stay”
Reviews.Author: lulubirdy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 4/2-4/5 and then again with late check in on 4/7 to fly out early the next morning. On 4/2, after a long plane ride, the staff gave both kids cookies and water on arrival. The room was comfortable, nice pool open until 11pm and free internet. The location was perfect, near Space Needle, monorail and bus stops. There was enough choices for breakfast to satisfy all. When we returned late on 4/7, we did not receive the same warm welcome with cookies, etc., but it was still nice. Also on 4/7, the internet room was closed and we would have loved to check in for our flight online. Also I liked our first room a little better, but still no complaints. It was clean and roomy. We just enjoyed the first stay so much more. We did not even get breakfast during the 4/7 stay because we checked out so early the next morning. The staff did arrange for a town car to the airport at $30 which is much less than a cab. In hindsight, I should have just checked for a late flight home on 4/7.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent, rude”
Reviews.Author: ashenrider
Reviews.Content: Well we never actually got to stay here, a group of us girls (5 total) booked a suite through the hotel website as a priority club member. We prepaid and our credit card was charged. When we actually showed up to check in imagine our surprise when they had given away our room. We were even more surprised when they told us that we had not actually paid for the room and that they could give us another smaller room for $100 more. A phone call to our credit card company proved that the room had been charged. They would not help us or even get their manager. A few phone calls later to corporate office and several apologies later we were promised a full refund. Yipee! But that didn't give us a place to stay. Luckily the Travel Lodge across the street was able to accomodate our group last minute and even saved us money. I would be a little leary booking through this chain, especially if you need to be assured a room will be there for you when you try to check-in. Only the very flexible should attempt staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for a tourist!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place back in Aug "05" for 3 nights and thought it was great! I had a room on the 3rd floor facing the highway and yes it was a little noisy but fortunately i was still a little jetlagged so i didn't hear it half the time as i slept like a log! The rooms were quite comfortable and spacious and the Tv had quite a large selection of cable channels. As for the hotel facilities i never used the pool so can't comment on that but i did use the gym and although small it was quite sufficient. They had coin operated laundries on site, and in the reception area you present your hotel keycard to reception and they give you free internet access in a little room they have off to the side! I found the staff very helpful and courteous! It is located in a nice safe area about a 15 min walk to pioneer square, markets, wharf, city centre etc All in all an excellent experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for seeing Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: travelpassion
Reviews.Content: Five of us (family) stayed in this hotel for a 3-night city break. We had a 2-bedroomed suite with a total of 3 double beds and a sofa bed. The two bathrooms came in very handy and the small kitchen area with a large fridge was also very useful. The rooms overlooked the Space Needle and were very clean if a bit small. There is secure underground parking at extra cost but on street parking is extremely limited so it is best to use the hotel car park. The hotel is not ideally situated, the front is situated on a very busy dual carriageway but it is only a five minute drive to the centre of Seattle and a 10-minute walk to the Space Needle. We walked into the city centre a couple of times and it took about 25 minutes but was quite pleasant. The hotel has a small swimming pool and a reasonable American Continental Breakfast is served in a small breakfast room. This was one of the best value accommodations in Seattle and we were more than happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn nothing more nothing less”
Reviews.Author: a1scuba
Reviews.Content: I had to fly out to Seattle on a last minute assignment. A third party made the hotel arrangments. This property is located about 40 minutes from the Airport. It is a tad confusing because the Holiday Inn Express backs up to a Holiday Inn, Also the traffic pattern getting into and away from the hotel is also somewhat confusing. The room I had was small and faced Aurora, a very busy and loud street. The Space Needle hovered outside my window about 2 blocks away. Between the rain and the fan on the heater it drowned out most of the noise. Even though small the room was clean and comfortable, refigerator, coffee pot were in good shape. The attached restaurant, the Emerald Club was good for a sandwich and a beer. To me this was a typical Holiday Inn - almost like a McDonalds hamburger, about the same no matter where you are... If the company was paying I might stay here again - if I was paying I'd probably look for a Hilton property further out. Gregg Deltastr@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Superb Choice”
Reviews.Author: Travel Lady2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on 23 and 24 September. This hotel was an excellent choice. Our room (#610) was on the top floor and it had cathedral ceilings. The room faced Aurora Avenue. There was some street noise but that doesn't bother us. We did have a fabulous view of the Space Needle. Our room had a king bed and it was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good and there was a wide variety to choose from. We spent the weekend in the downtown and harbor area so the location was good. On the Monday we took a cruise on the Mercury and we walked to the cruise terminal from the hotel. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: EtherealGirl
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent one miserable night at this property. Yes, it's close to all the attractions of Seattle center but.. The beds were hard and uncomfortable. The noise from Aurora Ave being right outside was unbearable and made it impossible to sleep. If you do stay here, request a room on the alley side! As other posters have said, the parking is HORRENDOUS. I drive a small car and had difficulty maneuvering in and out of the parking space. Oh, and if you leave and return later in the evening, expect the parking garage to be full when you get back! The people in the room above us were having a party. We called security and they quieted down... for about 10 minutes. Another call... 10 minutes of quiet then it was back to jumping on the beds....another call.. and nothing changed. I would think that, after that many complaints, the hotel staff would have asked them to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Kelly5612
Reviews.Content: All I really want out of a hotel room is a comfortable bed and a hot shower -- and this place could not even provide those two things consistently. Our non-smoking request was ignored and when I refused to take the "Marlboro Factory" suite they tried to give us, they downgraded us to a queen/sofabed room, promising to move us. That never happened. The room did not come with a safe and they were unable to provide a security box for me ("we can't find the keys"). There was no hot water one morning. The remote didn't work. The soda machines were broken. I called the front desk twice during a 3-night stay and was told someone would get back to me. No one ever did. Petty complaints? Yeah, some are. But when they accumulate on a daily basis, something is wrong with the hotel. Management seems unfamiliar with the phrase "the devil is in the details." (By the way, the general manager is really good at ignoring complaints and phone calls. I'm *still* waiting.)

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: mattressmonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights 4 days apart. The first room was great-alot for the money. The second room was kinda gross. The bathtub drain was clogged with hair and there were numerous stains on the carpet. Good views of the space needle in both rooms. Easy walk to the free bus line. Desk service is hit or miss- I advise you call your own taxi. There was a seafair parade in the area with street closures-we called prior to arrival to ask which streets were closed and the front desk had no clue. He advised we try to park on the street somewhere and walk. We made it to the parking lot by taking back streets and asking cops. I like Holiday Inn Express-we had the queen mini suite gov. rate of $124. good deal.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Seattle City Center
HotelInfo.Address: 226 Aurora Ave., Seattle, WA 98109
